DataElement.preferredName: Hormonal Contraception End Use Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/No/Not Applicable indicator of whether patient has discontinued hormonal contraception.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The birth control method that utilizes external source of sex hormones to prevent pregnancy by interfering with the ovulation, fertilization or implantation of the fertilized egg in the uterus._The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The birth control method that utilizes external source of sex hormones to prevent pregnancy by interfering with the ovulation, fertilization or implantation of the fertilized egg in the uterus.

Concepts.definition: The birth control method that utilizes external source of sex hormones to prevent pregnancy by interfering with the ovulation, fertilization or implantation of the fertilized egg in the uterus.

Property.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.
